intro: Tritoma rigidissima, commonly known as the rigid tritoma, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its stiff, upright stems and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a slightly hairy texture. Tritoma rigidissima is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
